noun.description: A mineral that is a borate of manganese and magnesium, Mg₂MnO₂(BO₃), occurring as tabular black crystals of a metallic appearance that belong to the monoclinic system.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal of Science. From ancient Greek πινάκιον small tablet (from πινακ-, πίναξ + -ιον, diminutive suffix) + -lite, after German Pinakiolit.
